attributes.action: scrap Section 76 of the Counter Terrorism Act, which prohibits the taking of photographs of any member of the armed or police forces.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Section 76 of the Counter Terrorism Act came into force on Monday 16th of February 2009. 

It permits the arrest of anyone found "eliciting, publishing or communicating information" relating to members of the armed forces, intelligence services and police officers, which is "likely to be useful to a person committing or preparing an act of terrorism". 

That means anyone taking a picture of one of those people could face a fine or a prison sentence of up to 10 years. 

The Royal Family are part of the Armed Forces. Are we going to be stopped from photographing them?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
